page.title: 17EMPLOYMENT
page.content: My Dad gets up very early in the morning in order to get to work on time because he works at Burton Stather near Scunthorpe. It takes him thirty minutes or more to get there. My Dad's work is at the bottom of a big hill, and the wharf is called Kings Ferry Wharf and it is at the side of the River Trent. It has many boats, mainly cargo boats and ferries. My Dad ships in steel and timber. There is one big black crane and two small white and orange ones. My Dad is Manager. When we go to the Sailing Club in the Summer we see a lot of lorries bringing coal from Germany. There are lots of places now on the Humber River where ships can unload. The places are very muddy and dangerous. Coal makes our boats dirty and we have to keep washing them.
